meanings.sent1: She is such a pouters when she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: The child turned into a pouters when he was told he couldn't have any more candy.
meanings.sent3: Even though he was just joking, his friend teased him by calling him a pouters.
meanings.sent4: Her brother can be a real pouters when he doesn't want to do his chores.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's face scrunched up into a perfect pouters as she sulked.

meanings.definition: A type of domestic pigeon with a puffed-out chest.
meanings.sent1: The pouters in the park looked majestic with their chests puffed out.
meanings.sent2: I saw a beautiful pouters perched on the fence in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The pouters in the aviary seemed to be showing off their impressive chests.
meanings.sent4: The pouters in the competition strutted around proudly, displaying their puffed-out chests.
meanings.sent5: The pouters cooed softly as they flaunted their puffed-out chests in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A type of fish with a protruding mouth.
meanings.sent1: The pouters in the aquarium had mouths that stuck out like little tubes.
meanings.sent2: I caught a peculiar pouters while fishing, its mouth was unlike any other fish I've seen.
meanings.sent3: The pouters in the pond always seemed to be making funny faces with their protruding mouths.
meanings.sent4: The pouters in the lake were nicknamed 'puckered lips' due to their unique mouths.
meanings.sent5: The pouters swam gracefully, their protruding mouths giving them a distinct appearance.
